topic: QC Logs API Does Not Return Backtest Logs
canonical: QC API endpoints /api/v2/backtests/read and /api/v2/backtests/logs/read do NOT return log data from backtests. Use RuntimeStatistics (accessible via API), QC Research notebook for historical data, or parse logs from cloud UI manually.

metadata.notes: Discovered 2024-12-09. Multiple attempts confirmed logs are not retrievable via API.

topic: QC ObjectStore is Ephemeral in Backtests
canonical: ObjectStore only persists data in LIVE mode. In backtests, data saved to ObjectStore is lost after backtest ends. For backtests: use logging + parse logs externally, OR use Research notebook to fetch data separately.

metadata.notes: Algorithm saved CSVs to ObjectStore but data did not persist after backtest.

canonical: Formula (exit_pnl / peak_pnl) * 100 produces garbage when peak is small positive and exit is negative. Only calculate capture rate for trades with meaningful positive peaks (e.g., peak > 5%). Add bounds checking: if peak_pnl <= 0.05, skip capture rate calculation.

metadata.notes: Produced -2041% capture rate due to edge case.

canonical: When editing files: .ipynb files require NotebookEdit tool (not Edit tool). .py files use Edit tool. Attempting Edit on .ipynb will fail.

metadata.notes: Tool usage pattern for Claude Code.

canonical: Keep trading algorithm and analysis code separate. Algorithm = trading logic only (entry, exit, position management). Analysis = separate Research notebooks or Python scripts. Extract data via API, analyze externally. Do not put analysis/reporting logic inside trading algorithm.

GET https://www.quantconnect.com/api/v2/backtests/orders/read | Auth: HTTP Basic (USER_ID, SHA256(API_TOKEN:timestamp)) | Headers: {Timestamp: unix_timestamp} | Params: {projectId, backtestId, start, end} | Returns: {orders: [...]} | Paginate with start/end (100 per page)

metadata.notes: Reliable API for extracting trade data from backtests.
